intro: Rondeletia breedlovei, commonly known as the red-eyed rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces bright red flowers with yellow centers, making it a striking ornamental species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
